content.body: PSA relayed from TabAtkins : Bikeshed's reference database has changed. https://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/spec-prod/2023JanMar/0004.html . I suspect some of our specs may need small updates and will break on the next build.

content.body: Ms2ger: Yeah we're still dependent on ES marking things up usefully, so if an aop is solely present as a heading and not a dfn they need to fix it

content.body: annevk: Hm, "implementation-defined" exists in Infra and ES, and appear to be essentially the same definition. I'm inclined to default that to Infra, unless you object?

content.body:
> <@tabatkins:matrix.org> Ms2ger: Yeah we're still dependent on ES marking things up usefully, so if an aop is solely present as a heading and not a dfn they need to fix it

I bet the JS editors (Shu, Bakkot and Michael Ficarra) would be interested in getting these issues addressed at some level or other if you raise it to them; they have done a lot of work in getting various spec elements' metadata improved so that things can be mechanized.
